properties.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 10:39PM PST until January 1 at 2:45PM PST by NWS Seattle WA
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a flood warning
for the following rivers in Washington...

Skokomish River near Potlatch affecting Mason County.

Heavy rains over the southern portions of the Olympics will cause the Skokomish river to go over flood stage tonight and Wednesday.

The National Weather Service in Seattle has issued a

* Flood Warning for
The Skokomish River near Potlatch
* until Wednesday afternoon.
* At 10:15 PM Tuesday the stage was 16.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 16.5 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue to rise and crest near 16.7 feet
around 4 AM Wednesday. The river will fall below flood stage
Wednesday morning.
* Impact...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread
flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West
Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. The evacuation route will
be opened to the west end of the Skokomish Valley Road.
properties.instruction:
Do not drive cars...vans...or trucks through flooded areas...this is
the cause of most flood related deaths in Washington. Be alert for
rapid changes and monitor developments by listening to NOAA Weather
radio or other local media.
